Package com.intellij.codeInspection.streamToLoop

Class FunctionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.codeInspection.streamToLoop.FunctionHelper

  • public abstract class FunctionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class which represents an expression mapped to the functional interface (like lambda, method reference or normal reference)

      • tryLightTransform

        public java.lang.String tryLightTransform()
        Try to perform "light" transformation. Works only for single-argument SAM. The function helper decides by itself how to name the SAM argument and returns the assigned name. After this method invocation normal transform cannot be performed.
        Returns:
        SAM argument name or null if function helper refused to perform a transformation.

      • transform

        public abstract void transform(ChainContext context,
                               java.lang.String... argumentValues)
        Adapts this function helper converting it to the valid expression and inlining SAM parameters with provided values. Must be called exactly once prior using getExpression() or getText().
        Parameters:
        context - a context for which transformation should be performed
        argumentValues - values (expressions) of the SAM parameters to be inlined into function body (the length must be exactly the same as the number of SAM parameters). Usually it's just the references to the existing variables, but other expressions (e.g. constant literals) could be used as well if necessary.

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.String oldName,
                   java.lang.String newName,
                   ChainContext context)
        Rename the references of some variable if it's used inside this function
        Parameters:
        oldName - old variable name
        newName - new variable name
        context - a context

      • replaceVarReference

        public static <T extends PsiElement> T replaceVarReference(T expressionOrCodeBlock,
                                                           java.lang.String name,
                                                           java.lang.String replacement,
                                                           ChainContext context)
        Replaces all the references to the variable name in given expression with replacement.

        If the replacement is a new name to the variable, the caller must take care that this new name was not used before.

        Parameters:
        expressionOrCodeBlock - an expression or code block to search-and-replace references inside
        name - a reference name to replace
        replacement - a replacement expression (new name or literal)
        context - context
        Returns:
        resulting expression (might be the same as input expression)
